definitions: a system whereby the government undertakes to protect the health and well-being of its citizens, especially those in financial or social need, by means of grants, pensions, and other benefits. The foundations for the modern welfare state in the US were laid by the New Deal programs of President Franklin D. Roosevelt.
shortDefinitions: system whereby state undertakes to protect health and well-being of its citizens

definitions: a country practicing a welfare state system.
shortDefinitions: country that has welfare state system
